function.description: User enters their weight in kilograms or pounds.
User enters their height in centimeters or inches.
User selects the unit system (metric or imperial).
System computes the BMI using the provided weight and height.
System displays the calculated BMI value to the user.
System shows BMI category (underweight, normal, overweight, obese) based on the BMI value.
System displays health tips based on the BMI category.
User can reset the inputs to enter new values.
Provides features such as text-to-speech for accessible use.
Allow users to view current exchange rates for different currencies.
Enable users to choose a currency they want to convert from.
Enable users to choose a currency they want to convert to.
Allow users to enter the amount they wish to convert.
Calculate and display the converted amount based on the selected currencies and input amount.
Display a history of past currency conversion transactions.
Allow users to view historical exchange rates for currencies.
Allow users to set their preferred default base and target currencies.
Enable users to switch between dark and light themes.
Allows the user to generate a random password based on selected criteria.
Offers options for users to choose password length, include symbols, numbers, uppercase, and lowercase letters.
Enables users to copy the generated password to the clipboard.
Allows users to set a default password length for future password generations.
Enables users to toggle the inclusion of symbols in generated passwords.
Allows users to turn on or off the inclusion of numbers in passwords.
Lets users choose to include or exclude uppercase letters in passwords.
Permits users to enable or disable lowercase letters in passwords.
Provides answers to frequently asked questions about using the password generator.
Offers a way for users to contact support if they encounter issues or have questions.
Allows users to create a QR code by entering data.
Provides a form for users to get in touch with the support team.
Offers information about the QR code generator and its features.
Field for users to enter the data they want to encode in the QR code.
Options for users to select the design and color of the QR code.
Displays a preview of the QR code before downloading.
Allows users to download the generated QR code image.
Provides video tutorials on how to use the QR code generator.
Frequently asked questions and answers section for users.
Detailed instructions on using different features of the website.
Information about the company and its mission.
Introduces the team members behind the QR code generator.
User reviews and feedback about the QR code generator.

Read the dataset Gamedata.xlsx into the program.
Shift the 'result' column by one period to create the dependent variable with a one-period-lag.
Build a logistic regression model using the shifted 'result' column as the dependent variable and all other columns as independent variables.
Generate a summary of the logistic regression model.
Output the summary of the logistic model into Logistic.xlsx.

User can upload the 'Deathlist.csv' file with the death data.
User can view the generated weekly death histogram.
User can configure the date format if the date in the file is not recognized correctly.
System processes data to produce a histogram of weekly deaths based on the 'Date of death' field.
User can adjust the time frame to see the histogram for different periods (e.g., monthly, quarterly).
User can download the generated histogram as an image or PDF.
